    • Method Detail

      • getScaleRatio

        public static float getScaleRatio(@NonNull
                                  android.app.Activity activity,
                                  @NonNull
                                  java.lang.String path)
        Computes the scale ratio which should be used to down-scale the image to fit in the screen. The image will be obtained by the provided image path as String. In case the image is smaller than the device screen, the ratio will be 1.0, which means, the up-scale is not going to be computed.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity context.
        path - String - The String path of the image.
        Returns:
        float - Returns the image ratio, the result is in between 0.0f and 1.0f.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getScaleRatio

        public static float getScaleRatio(@NonNull
                                  android.graphics.Rect imageDimens,
                                  @NonNull
                                  android.graphics.Rect windowDimens)
        Computes the scale ratio which should be used to down-scale the image to fit in the screen. Dimensions of the image and window will be used as Rect parameters. In case the image is smaller than the device screen, the ratio will be 1.0, which means, the up-scale is not going to be computed.
        Parameters:
        imageDimens - Rect - The image dimensions as a Rect object.
        windowDimens - Rect - The window dimensions as a Rect object.
        Returns:
        float
        Since:
        1.0

      • getScreenDimens

        public static android.graphics.Rect getScreenDimens(@NonNull
                                                    android.app.Activity activity)
        Gets the device screen dimensions and put them in a Rect object.
        Parameters:
        activity - Activity - The activity context.
        Returns:
        Rect - The device screen dimensions represented as a rectangle.
        Since:
        1.0

      • isLandscape

        public static boolean isLandscape(@NonNull
                                  android.graphics.Rect rec)
        Will check the orientation of a given rectangle.
        Parameters:
        rec - Rect - The rectangle which should be checked.
        Returns:
        boolean - If the rectangle orientation is in landscape will return true, if not it will return false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getImageDimens

        public static android.graphics.Rect getImageDimens(@NonNull
                                                   java.lang.String imagePath)
        Gets the image dimensions and put them in a Rect object.
        Parameters:
        imagePath - String - The String path to the image file.
        Returns:
        Rect - The image dimensions represented as a rectangle object.
        Since:
        1.0
